## Introduction

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars, echo= FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

gt(head(mtcars))

```

```{r , echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include = FALSE}

#Select the 'iris' dataset
iris<-(iris)

#Create a list of Metrics to run through  
HeaderTable<- iris %>% distinct(Species) 

#Create a blank output  
  out = NULL

#Create a loop to loop through the value    
  for (j in 1:nrow(`HeaderTable`)) {
    
#select the current metric in the loop to use in the template file.    
CurrentMetric<-HeaderTable$Species[j]

#create an output for each metric     
out<- c(out, knit_child('iris_Template.Rmd'))
  
  }
  
```


```{r, echo = FALSE, results='asis'}

cat(paste(out, collapse = '\n'))

```
